ca.carleton.sysc3110.project.models.plants

Class Plant

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.carleton.sysc3110.project.models.BoardElement
      • ca.carleton.sysc3110.project.models.plants.Plant
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<BoardElement>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Potato, SeedSpitter, Sunflower

    public class Plant
extends BoardElement
    The Class Plant. Each plant will have a cost to plant (sunCost) and in the future we may consider adding a sunUpkeepCost which would be a cost applied every turn or cycle used to upkeep the existing plants. The plant speed is 0 because most plants are stationary. The cooldown is the variable used to control how frequently that plant can be planted. The shotCoolDown and shotTimer variables are used to regular how frequently the plants will fire. Once the cooldown decreases below the timer value the variables are reset and another shot is fired. Finally the shot type will indicate what kind of shot the plant shoots such as SEED, NONE, and possible future implementation of ICE_SEED.
    Author:
    John Blackwood , Ian Wong
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
